Description: This Forum will provide information about the definition, types, and prevalence of medical financial hardship following a cancer diagnosis and evidence about its association with adverse patient outcomes, including worse health-related quality of life and symptom severity, disruptions to medical care, and higher mortality risk.  Speakers will summarize current approaches to address cancer-related financial hardship, including patient navigation interventions; efforts by providers in community practice; state and federal policies; employer practices; and provider training.  Discussion will highlight the importance of multi-level intervention to mitigate financial hardship and improve receipt of recommended cancer treatment and patient outcomes.
